intro: Serrafalcus racemosus subsp. commutatus, commonly known as the Commutatus Serrafalcus, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and elliptical leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are capsules that release seeds when mature. This subspecies is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
